intro: Tetrahit ladanum, commonly known as the ladanum tree, is a small evergreen shrub or tree native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of yellow flowers. The plant produces small, round fruits that are typically covered in a sticky resin. It is often found in rocky soils and thrives in sunny, well-drained environments. Due to its ornamental value and historical use in perfumery, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
